subject: Ethics
title: Social Media Addiction by Design
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Social Media Addiction by Design.

hook.text: Instagram's own research found it worsens body image in teenage girls. They hid the report.

buildup.text: Social media platforms use variable reward schedulesâ€”the same psychology that makes slot machines addictive.

discovery.text: Every pull-to-refresh, notification ping, and infinite scroll is engineered to keep you coming back.

twist.text: Tech executives limit their own children's screen time. They know what they built.

climax.text: The question isn't if social media is addictive. It's whether deliberately designing addiction is ethical.

punchline.text: They built the trap, then warned their kids to avoid it.
